website_summaries.verdict: Fun and easy to use. Because it requires no electrical power, you can use the shuffler anywhere.
pros: Runs quieter than a battery card shuffler
With hand crank shuffling system, dead batteries are no problem
Lightweight machine that's easy to carry
Not as rough on the cards as other options, so cards last longer
cons: Older playing cards may cause the unit to jam or to not be engaged
Doesn't work as fast as some

customer_reviews.title: Finally ...this thing is awesome
customer_reviews.text: I've been searching for this for years. My old crappy battery shuffler has never worked great I just didn't know any better . So glad I got this. See video review
customer_reviews.author: Big Daddy

customer_reviews.title: a minor adjustment and it works great
customer_reviews.text: when first trying it the cards kept jamming on one side of the feeder stack . It appeared to have a burr from an injection sprue on the clear cover . I took a diamond finger nail file and worked it where it appeared to be jamming .After a little work the cards were cycling through real good. I also found that a rapid shuffle has less chance of jamming.. Do not over fill it .
customer_reviews.author: Tony Fox

customer_reviews.title: Best unit for regular use
customer_reviews.text: We have been using the battery powered units for a long time and after these units arrived I tossed the old ones into the bin. These require no batteries, and have a much better 'grip' on the cards during shuffle. The hand crank is plastic, so after the unit is assembled you won't want to take it apart, but you shouldn't have to. The battery type units have two steel pins that the push activator will push together, but the flow of power generates heat in the pins and they will slowly melt through the activation part. This action weakens the part to the point it can no longer make contact. Don't bother. Buy this hand crank version instead.
customer_reviews.author: P. Hinds

customer_reviews.title: Aerates half a deck of cards, that is all!
customer_reviews.text: This does not work well at all. One side shoots the cards perfectly fine and rather consistently, but the other side does not feed the cards as it should. I have tried applying a light finger touch to the top of the card pile to increase traction, tried old and brand new cards and gently worn cards. For unknown reasons the roller feed on one side will not grab and feed the cards. This is a total shuffle failure. There is not such thing as aerating half a deck of cards! This is the first time I have bought something and not bothered with returning the item. DO NOT BUY THIS SHUFFLER!!
customer_reviews.author: S. Lipson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!!
customer_reviews.text: For those in the group who have trouble with shuffling or are slow-pokes, this item works great. Works exactly as advertised for such a small price. Just crank for a few seconds and decks are shuffled! Why spend extra money for a battery-operated unit that don't have the same reliability, when you can get a reasonably-priced unit and just crank for a few seconds? I highly reccommend this item!
customer_reviews.author: beverly

customer_reviews.title: Can't hand shuffle
customer_reviews.text: A group of us play cards frequently and only one of us can still truly shuffle them. In the past several years we have gone through three battery operated shufflers. One just "wore out", one stopped working on one side, and the last had batteries that moved inside it so we spent more time putting them in place than shuffling the cards. These experiences made me very happy to find a hand operated one and, after we tried it, we decided that having two was a good idea so we could shuffle faster.
customer_reviews.author: Carroll Parsons

customer_reviews.title: A big help shuffling board game cards.
customer_reviews.text: Kind of cheaply made, but about what I expected and the price was right. I have several new board games and find I don't addequately shuffle the cards by hand and the distribution was terrible. Running the cards through this a few times on my Mechs and Minions cards worked wonders and my five year old son loved shuffling the cards in it. I just wish is could shuffle up to tarot sized cards instead of just standard playing cards as many games come with larger cards. BTW this worked good with standard playing cards and small zomnicide game cards. If you got a "jam" you notice immediatele, turn the crank backwards a turn and then continue shuffling.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: So Much Fun To Use
customer_reviews.text: I never learned how to shuffle cards, but I like to play a few games. Whenever it was my turn to shuffle, people would become impatient with me trying to shuffle. Since I bought this contraption, I am shuffling like a pro. It freaks people out too. They see me get out my shuffler and they think I am a serious player, sort of like hustling in reverse. I start out looking like a serious player, but continue to lose. It is fun to use this. Sometimes one of the other players reaches over my arm and moves the crank, that's how fun it is.
customer_reviews.author: Jewel Schultz

customer_reviews.title: Great shuffler.... not crazy about the crank handle...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great shuffler but the handle is a little flimsy so you have to not get overly aggressive with it, other than that it does a great job shuffling.I use it to shuffle Rook cards which are smaller than regular playing cards.Works great for both though.The people who make this need to beef up the crank handle.
customer_reviews.author: sothpaw 68

customer_reviews.title: after a modification works very well!
customer_reviews.text: had the same problem as loads of other people did and decided it would be fine as a two-person task. yep! i turned the crank while my friend put the tips of his index fingers under the outside edge of each stack of cards. that puts the cards at a steeper angle and then both sides feed brilliantly! now i'm thinking a stick-on furniture bumper on each side or something like that could work...??? or a wedge of the exactly perfect size and shape.
customer_reviews.author: loveonlineshopping

customer_reviews.title: Works good! Nice to have.
customer_reviews.text: Like a few others here ARTHRITIS has prompted me to try this gadget. I've had it for a few weeks now and It is working fine for me. I am getting better at finding the 50/50 break on the deck but still even with the exact 26 cards on each side sometimes one side will still finish first but no biggie. Cut 'em a few times and shuffle again. I play a quick game of solitaire so it takes a few shuffles to get the cards mixed good. For the price, I am very happy (with the shuffler).
customer_reviews.author: twoshirts

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Would definitely not recommend this product for the money. The crank handle would not stay in the slot, and we had to glue it in to make it work. After about four times of shuffling cards it would not shuffle cards one by one, but clump some together or not work at all. Paid $16 and would expect better than this.
customer_reviews.author: Mary T - OK

customer_reviews.title: Shuffles cards well once you get the hang of it.
customer_reviews.text: Only one issue with this unit: You have to turn the crank pretty fast to get the cards to shuffle. If you go too slowly or slow down in the middle of a shuffle the cards will fall down sideways and screw up the deck. My friends have a hard time shuffling cards because of stiffness in their fingers and at first they were hesitant, but once you get the feel for it, it works OK.
customer_reviews.author: Drache

customer_reviews.title: Card shuffler
customer_reviews.text: This is the easiest card shuffler I have ever used,no batteries required either . We love it. Use it all the time,it's so much easier than doing it by hand! Which is good when your hands don't work like they once did.
customer_reviews.author: Remote lady

customer_reviews.title: My shuffling hands are thanking me!
customer_reviews.text: Love this shuffler! The crank (on the bottom, then you put it in the side slot) works easily and smoothly. Beats hand-shuffling 2 decks at a time! Time will tell how it lasts though. I did have a couple of cards get stuck. I recommend making sure they are all nice and straight before turning the crank.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: What a time (and thumb) saver!
customer_reviews.text: Shuffles large decks of Uno cards in a jiffy! If you crank it steady and not too fast, it shuffles the cards nicely and every bit as good, sometimes better, than hand shuffling. The hand crank is better than a battery powered because you aren't having to search for batteries (or discover you don't have the right size batteries) and the shuffler is dead when your card party shows up!) We've been more than pleased with our hand crank card shuffler!
customer_reviews.author: gerry

customer_reviews.title: Nice price
customer_reviews.text: With all the stuff I hear about automatic shufflers and how they break too easily, I took a chance with this one. I've used it a lot over the past few weeks. It has not had any issues. My 70+ yr old parents love it because they find it hard to shuffle two decks. Great stuff and no batteries required.
customer_reviews.author: totsubo

customer_reviews.title: Works well after you get used to it.
customer_reviews.text: It took a little while for me to get used to using this card shuffler. At first it was jamming quite a bit. I learned that cranking it pretty fast will prevent most jams, and when it does start to jam, if you just briefly turn the crank in the opposite direction, it will turn loose and you can resume the shuffling. It holds two decks of cards, but of only standard size. Oversize cards will not fit into the shots.
customer_reviews.author: xplorer

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Both my husband and I are seniors which means our old hands don't always work as well as they used to. Shuffling cards is one of those things that is cumbersome at best. After reading a lot of reviews, I ordered this card shuffler and it works great. My only recommendation is you crank slowly because if you go too fast, a card will get stuck in the mechanism. Other than that, it works great. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Gaye Levy

customer_reviews.title: Works fine, but not perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Experience: Cards must be fairly new. One side always finishes first and leaves a dozen cards or so on the other side. We compensate for this by always loading the quicker side w more cards. Most shuffles work fine w an occasional backpedal needed to unclog. Overall, though we would rather have it vs manual shuffling which bends the cards, etc. For the price I do think it's a buy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Shuffles great and fast
customer_reviews.text: Works very good. kids like to use it for UNO games and my son when we play spades because his hands are to small to shuffle cards. Shuffles very fast if your in a big hurry also.
customer_reviews.author: AndyMan517

customer_reviews.title: Tough and fast
customer_reviews.text: I'm a Canasta nut and use this every week. Some people are pretty fierce cranking the cards through, and it's surprisingly durable. A great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Pellucid

customer_reviews.title: Don't Buy, very cheap
customer_reviews.text: Cheaply made and have already made arrangements to return. Didn't want to use since it seemed it would break and I would be liable. Don't buy this!!!!
customer_reviews.author: J. Moreno

customer_reviews.title: Great little shuffler.
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best shufflers we have bought. It holds two decks of cards and gets the job done nicely and quietly. We have the battery operated ones and this is our go to shuffler. It clogs up every now and then but, just crank the handle backwards then forward and it’s good to go. Remember when delivered the handle is under the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Lanelle

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Used for first time and it worked fine. As stated in some other reviews it might jam a little if you are too aggressive with it. But easy to clear. It is plastic but with care it should last fine. I did have a little trouble attaching the crank but I was able to snap it in place and it is working fine. Four of us used this shuffler and were pleased with it. In fact the other couple are going to purchase one as well.
customer_reviews.author: BEVERLY M

customer_reviews.title: not the best
customer_reviews.text: product came broken. winding at the back to shuffling the cards is a hustle with the knob kept falling out. For the price with other comparable it is more expensive. I would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: solid gold

customer_reviews.title: Excellent purchase and well worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Shuffling a deck of Uno cards after each hand it Bruno got to be pretty tiresome! I was looking for a solution that was not Electric or relied on Batteries. This shuffler was an excellent solution. My son loves helping to shuffle the cards, and I find I can completely shuffle the deck quite a few times in a short amount of time. The handle is located on the bottom of the shuffler, so make sure you look for that. Excellent purchase and so glad I did it!
customer_reviews.author: K Poppins

customer_reviews.title: ... this device in a timely manner and am very pleased with it
customer_reviews.text: I received this device in a timely manner and am very pleased with it. The reviews of this shuffler were spot on and it is such a pleasure now to shuffle multiple decks. Although it is a two deck shuffler its a small extra step for me to shuffle a Skip Bo deck by removing the cards from the holding bay when it fills and keep cranking. Then just stack the last batch on top and repeat.
customer_reviews.author: Farnsworth

customer_reviews.title: I do not recommend.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is garbage. Very cheaply made and doesnt work at all. I'm returning. Not worth 20 cents let alone almost twenty dollars. I do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Brown

customer_reviews.title: easy, quiet, works well, light-weight
customer_reviews.text: My card group loves this shuffler. We've been though several of those battery-operated ones, that are noisy, don't work well and break soon. We even tried an older mechanical one from eBay with no luck. This one is light-weight (making it easy to pass around the table and set out of the way when not in use), quiet, easy to use and works. Plus no batteries to keep replacing. Don't try to forcefully jam the cards right up against the center when you're putting them in - just gently set them into each side. If a card jams, just slowly crank in the other direction to free it. Easy!
customer_reviews.author: Evelyn Brengle

customer_reviews.title: Old fashioned, light-duty shuffler
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my husband, because the photo reminded me so much of dusty 1970s game storage at grandparents' homes and because he is a slow shuffler. No wonder every older person seemed to have one back in my childhood! Quick, easy, no-frills shuffling for two decks as described. Funky styling takes me back and makes our rummy games even more fun.
customer_reviews.author: Customer o  Kindle

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to shuffle two decks for playing gin. It works reasonably well meaning that occasionally the cards to jam. It definitely works better as the cards age. We bought new decks at the same time we bought the shuffler. The cards were most difficult to shuffle when brand new. The cards appear well shuffled.
customer_reviews.author: J. Colston

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS CARD SHUFFLER
customer_reviews.text: LOVE THIS CARD SHUFFLER! I bought this as a gift for my two Grand-boys [ages 8 and 10] who love to play Uno and Exploding Kittens. The need to shuffle the cards is constant and their hands are just too small. It works so well I was just amazed and thrilled. Thanks so much for making such an excellent product. I will now buy one for each of my other Grands. Life is good!
customer_reviews.author: Caroline Cowdrey

customer_reviews.title: The crank is on the bottom - works great.
customer_reviews.text: I wonder how many people who gave this a bad review and sent it back because "it didn't come with a crank" looked on the bottom of the shuffler (which is where the crank is stored). We purchased a cheap electric one at Target and it lasted about a month. This one works quickly and smoothly. No batteries is a big plus. We just got it so I hope my review holds after repeated uses, but we love it so far.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie

customer_reviews.title: It brought a smile to our faces - first thing!
customer_reviews.text: We are grandparents who love playing games with our kids and grand kids - but shuffling is pretty hard for little hands. This little gadget was just the ticket! Not only does it make shuffling accessible to all ages, it makes whatever game we are playing even more fun. We are sure there will be a bit of a battle over who gets to shuffle the cards now. We can't wait to put it to endless use.
customer_reviews.author: O. Madison

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Super disappointed in this product. The crank will not stay in place. Every time you shuffle you have to press the crank in and try to hold it in place so it doesn’t slip. We’ve stopped using it after only a few times of use because it’s more trouble than it’s worth.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: great for little hands
customer_reviews.text: Yes, this is plastic and doesn't seem like a very durable one, but the couple times we have tried it out it works great. The five year old was really getting into turning the crank and it flew off. I just reminded her that this isn't the most sturdy and we need to be careful. It shuffles beautifully. Now the kids can shuffle too.
customer_reviews.author: Twyla baxter

customer_reviews.title: Thin, cheap plastic but it's working for now
customer_reviews.text: Packaged very poorly. The shuffler is made from very thin plastic and shipped in the box with no padding so part of it was broken. I did take an old deck of cards and with a little work it did shuffle the cards. I don't think it's going to last...
customer_reviews.author: Tmd

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the price. No batteries needed. Fun to turn the handle between games.
customer_reviews.text: The newer coated cards seem to jam it a little bit. Have only used a few times. For the price, it works pretty well. I peeled the ugly Las Vegas sticker off. Looks much better without it. Plus, it’s fun to crank it and nice to not need batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Anyone can shuffle cards now.
customer_reviews.text: Watched a wikihow video on youtube after I ordered this. It was ranked number 1 for home use. Also because it is manual - no batteries required it can be used over and over without using caustic betteries. Friends and I love using it when we play Uno. I can't shuffle to save my life. So now I don't have to pass along my shuffling duties when it's my turn. Only drawback is the handle pin isn't long enough into the shaft so the handle pops out a lot when spinning it.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Will never shuffle by hand again
customer_reviews.text: The ease of shuffling cards with this thing makes me weep for the days when I didn't have one. I play UNO with my girlfriend regularly and we used to spend more time shuffling than actually playing. This shuffler does what is meant to do. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: J. Velez

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: This shuffler works great and gets the job done! Bought a second one for our little trailer so we always have it when camping. Like that it’s compact, doesn’t need batteries and fairly quiet. One improvement I’d like to see: A new box design. Once you attach the crank handle to the shuffler, you cannot store the shuffler back in the box. It doesn’t fit in the box with the handle. Granted I could probably take the handle on/off each time we want to use it, but I don’t think it was designed for that purpose and I may end up breaking it.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great card shuffler for cards and Uno!
customer_reviews.text: This was a wonderful gift for my mom who loves playing cards but hates shuffling! Super easy to assemble and I like how it is a crank vs batteries so you don’t have to worry about replacing batteries. Easy to assemble and use. Cards can get stuck if you do not crank in a smooth pattern (going from super fast to slow) but overall, no issues and cards are shuffled very well!
customer_reviews.author: Cam

customer_reviews.title: Does not shuffle well
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for games with double decks. It does not do a good job of "shuffling". It does not separate the cards well, but rather puts through multiple cards from each side at a time, when I can get the cards to actually feed through.
customer_reviews.author: Vi

customer_reviews.title: Our group of players has fun shuffling cards in this thing.
customer_reviews.text: Our group is older and most of us have small hands, so a double deck of cards doesn't always get shuffled well. Not anymore! This shuffler works well and is fun to operate. Update: After using this probably about twice a week for 6 months now, it is still working great and we still have fun using it.
customer_reviews.author: aherpa

customer_reviews.title: Not bad at all
customer_reviews.text: Works pretty well, solidly built, fairly quiet (nice bonus), and should be more reliable than the battery operated variety. It does seem to consistently pull cards faster from one side than the other, but that's manageable.
customer_reviews.author: NatCh

customer_reviews.title: Awesome shuffler
customer_reviews.text: This thing is so awesome! We use it for our card monopoly game, uno and other card games. The trick is to spin it fast so cards don’t get jammed. Don’t waste your money on an electronic one, get this one and you won’t need batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Juli K

customer_reviews.title: Works good may require some backing up or finagling
customer_reviews.text: This card shuffler works pretty good sometimes the cards will get jammed but half a crank back and you're ready to go again. My five year old loves using this thing to shuffle pokemon cards. The only card it won't take is the one that has corners bent up.
customer_reviews.author: Such Red Prey

customer_reviews.title: No batteries needed!
customer_reviews.text: No instructions at all in or on the box. Was confusing at first. Once I detached the crank from the bottom and attached it on the side, it was great! Friends were excited to use it with the crank. Used it With ten people at a game night and we loved it!
customer_reviews.author: Sue Wagner

customer_reviews.title: Its okay but very cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: This is very light weight and I'm wondering how long it will last. The handle is stored on the underside so it will be easy to loose. I decided to try the manual shuffler because the gears on the automatic shufflers eventually wear out and quit turning. It may be the same with this one so we shall see.
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: A well made product. Sometimes you need to turn slowly and other times you need to be more aggressive to force the cards through. But it works every time. We have used all sorts of playing cards and card games and haven't run into any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Darby Gray

customer_reviews.title: Works nicely
customer_reviews.text: A friend had one of these and I was impressed. This works well when shuffling multiple decks. I think it works ok but still get accused of stacking the deck even though it is impossible to do with this shuffler.
customer_reviews.author: jfd8982

customer_reviews.title: Works well, but what about the crank?
customer_reviews.text: Works well. It is possible to jam cards but not overfilling nor cranking too briskly seem to be the way to avoid those problems. I believe jamming cards for the most part is self-inflicted. I do not like the way the crank is stored as I fear the crank could be broken trying to return it to storage spot. We have only used the shuffler a few times so I cannot praise or condemn its length of life.
customer_reviews.author: RitzvilleBarry

customer_reviews.title: CHH Card Shuffler 2 Deck Hand Crank
customer_reviews.text: Only things that made not work well is when cards got bunched up or bumping each other and getting jammed in there. Just need to reset everything cause crank doesn't always do what it needs to either.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No batteries, works well, as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Shuffled a few decks when received this week, worked flawlessly. Glad I had read about the 'hand crank' that was underneath because there were no instructions with the unit and it is almost hidden. I especially like that there is no need for batteries- simple always works best.
customer_reviews.author: Curt Mattingly

customer_reviews.title: As advertised/works
customer_reviews.text: Easy to crank, usueful for someone who can not shuffle cards easily. Very basic, picture instructions on the box.
customer_reviews.author: JRNoffke

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Speeds up the game! My adult kids bought this as one of for their dad’s Father's Day gifts. It’s awesome! In this video, he gets through 2 decks in just seconds!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kristie

customer_reviews.title: Shuffling for dummies
customer_reviews.text: I can’t shuffle and I don’t care to learn. I play UNO with my kids and it’s freaking awesome! The video says it all.
customer_reviews.author: Asv

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Love this. Better than a battery operated shuffler. Two of my neighbors purchased one after they saw mine. Good for regular cards and 5Crown.
customer_reviews.author: Joan B.

customer_reviews.title: Does the job it's meant to do, for a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.text: It shuffles the cards just fine. Yes the handle might break one day, be careful. And sometimes it slightly needs a back and forth motion to keep the cards moving through, but really, for the price it's great. We all want to use it when we play our games! Holds 2 decks perfectly. Won't hold larger cards like Sushi Go, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Evans

customer_reviews.title: Works sooooo good
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes the little crank falls off when you are shuffling, but no big deal. So easy to use. Sometimes "old school" is the best.
customer_reviews.author: DJS

customer_reviews.title: As good as it gets!
customer_reviews.text: Needed shuffler for 84 yrs old mom with gnarled hands to play solitaire. Works better than I would've thought. Yes it light plastic and the handle occasionally pulls out. But she's happy with it and it keeps her occupied when bored. Works just fine example with a single normal size large print cards. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: review4 2

customer_reviews.title: No batteries needed
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use to shuffle cards. I would suggest that the turn handle needs to be easier to be easier to remove. I cut a hole in the box so I don't have to take the handle off the turner.
customer_reviews.author: md

customer_reviews.title: Better than the battery operated
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Better than the battery operated. I would give it 5 stars, if not for the fact that I bought this one to replace my last one, when the handle broke. Unfortunately you do not sell replacement handles, which would be the smart thing to do. Therefore, I had to replace the whole shuffler.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Works great!!  Awesome product!
customer_reviews.text: Love this product. A friend has trouble shuffling cards so we got one for her birthday. She loves it too. We liked it so much we bought us one.
customer_reviews.author: Lila

customer_reviews.title: IT’s THIS or 1960’s “C” battery shufflers ...really??
customer_reviews.text: A) Likes to shuffle cards in twos & threes I think. B) When cards jam, (butt head on), cranking the handle backward & forward again 1 or 2 times resolves the problem & shuffling resumes. C) Not noisy. D) Handle stores underneath. E) I find the clear plastic tray below unnecessary. F) w/o tray it CAN just barely do 3 card decks at once.
customer_reviews.author: K. Hammel

customer_reviews.title: OK Shuffler
customer_reviews.text: Does the job. A little flimsy - sometimes the cards get stuck during them shuffle. Just back off and it will restart. All plastic - don’t know how long the crank will last.
customer_reviews.author: Board Gamer

customer_reviews.title: In Case It Dosn't Work
customer_reviews.text: One side hung up. Worked fine, once I fixed it. Very tiny piece of plastic sticking down on one edge of the clear top cover. Trimmed it off. Also tiny piece of rubber sticking up from one of the wheels. Snipped It Off. Works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good value, does what it's supposed to
customer_reviews.text: This is a super-easy card shuffler/ My daughter loves using it and it's easy for her. We've played more games since getting it. I like that there's no battery to worry about and the handle is easy to use (and detachable, if you're taking it to another house).
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for our daughter with special needs (gross and fine motor skills are very poor) as she loves to play cards. It is perfect! She is so proud that she can shuffle cards on her own now!
customer_reviews.author: kel

customer_reviews.title: Very handy shuffler
customer_reviews.text: Works great, saves My hands and does a wonderful job shuffling My cards. Use it for everything from UNO to Canasta'....You don't need a high priced electric one.
customer_reviews.author: Joe American

customer_reviews.title: great shuffler
customer_reviews.text: Mechanical, excellent for people who have lost the strength in their fingers to shuffle cards. At most this handles two decks. The bigger ones that handled more decks did not work as well
customer_reviews.author: Virginia Turner

customer_reviews.title: Best option available.
customer_reviews.text: Good product, 4 stars, cause it does jam if not careful. Decided over battery operated/ automatic. Grand kids over age 12 like it & have figured out how to avoid jam ups.
customer_reviews.author: M. Tate

customer_reviews.title: Quick, easy, and works well
customer_reviews.text: Love this shuffler. It is quick, easy, and shuffles well. I had also bought a battery-operated one at the same time and it jammed up every time I tried it. This one may on occasion but rarely. I highly recommend this shuffler.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! It does jam up once in a while but nothing like the battery operated. Get the manual you won’t regret it. Yes, I would buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Works great

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use

customer_reviews.title: A fun shuffler for kids

customer_reviews.author: H. Miller

customer_reviews.title: So easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: Kiddos can use this with ease! It really works well in actually shuffling the cards. We put in 2 new decks, shuffled 7 times, and the cards were all mixed up. Perfect! And no batteries needed!
customer_reviews.author: spideygirl

customer_reviews.title: Works well, kids enjoy it.
customer_reviews.text: Used to have arguments when kids played card games about whether the player shuffling did it right. Problem solved, with bonus that the kids just enjoy putting in cards and turning the crank to see the shuffle happen. Labelled for two deck shuffling, it works fine for one deck. All plastic parts so not intended for intensive long term use like a recreation center, but perfect for family.
customer_reviews.author: Santa Barbara Mom

customer_reviews.title: Deal 'em Out!
customer_reviews.text: Had surgery on my thumb and could run not shuffle the cards. Had several of the battery operated types but they were noisy and the cards got stuck.
customer_reviews.author: Lollipop

customer_reviews.title: Fun, effective and easy for children to use
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Cards get stuck once in a while but you just have to be sure cards and against the inside roller. Great for Skipbo and 3 decks of cards. With my arthritic fingers it makes shuffling easier. Would buy another one in a heartbeat!

customer_reviews.title: I'd like to have one too
customer_reviews.text: My late wife's mother (turned 90 this year!) plays cards with her sister every weekend. She loves this as it saves her time and aggravation shuffling the cards. I'd like to have one too, but you can only fit so many extra items in an RV...

customer_reviews.title: Handy, fun and gives cards a longer lifespan.
